techmeme.title: Sources: Figma has met with banks in recent weeks to discuss an IPO that could come as soon as 2025; EU and US regulators stymied its $20B sale to Adobe in 2023 (New York Times)
Revolut and Visa file challenges against UK's Payment Systems Regulator, say it overstepped its powers with a plan to cap international digital transaction fees (Akila Quinio/Financial Times)
Sources: Kraken seeks to go public as soon as Q1 2026; the SEC recently agreed to drop its case against Kraken amid a friendlier regulatory climate under Trump (Olga Kharif/Bloomberg)
Sources: Cursor maker Anysphere is in talks to raise hundreds of millions at a $10B valuation, up from $2.5B in January, and crossed $100M in ARR in 12 months (Kate Clark/Bloomberg)
Meta is testing a feature that lets Threads users add their interests to their profile; the interests will direct users to active conversations about the topic (Sarah Perez/TechCrunch)
